intro: Hirtella hebeclada, commonly known as the hairy hirtella, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, which includes plants such as eucalyptus and clove. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are typically covered in fine, short hairs, giving it a fuzzy appearance. Hirtella hebeclada is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests.
